page.title: 10PUBLIC OPINION IN BRADWELL
page.content: When we interviewed people in the village we asked them what they thought of some of the amenities. Everyone was pleased with the{Health {Centre}because before it was opened the nearest chemist was in Gorleston and there were no dentists in the village. We asked people if they attended clubs or activities in the{Community {Centre.}We found that the only people who used the Centre were mothers with young children or the old aged pensioners. There are, though, quite a variety of activities such as whist drives, playgroup, over 60's, flower club and discos. The new traffic lights on Beccles Rd. were not very popular. Older people said there was not enough time to cross the road and others thought it held up traffic unnecessarily.
